availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Cawein (Louisville restaurant owner and merchant)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky restaurant owner and merchant. Germany native. Owned Walker’s Restaurant and Exchange with John Kohlepp and Charles K. Guefner from 1856 to 1866.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 1, p. 85. “Walker’s Exchange,” The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky), October 3, 1856, p. 2. “There’s a Buck in the Lick,” The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky), October 10, 1856, p. 4. “Walker’s Exchange,” The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky), January 9, 1860, p. 4. “Walker’s Exchange,” The Louisville Daily Courier (Louisville, Ky), January 4, 1861, p. 3. “Dissolution,” The Courier-Journal (Louisville, Ky), May 1, 1866, p. 2.
